title: Why do we have two eyes, but only see one of everything? - Quora

response.answer_text: First of all, you accidentally put a period instead of a comma, bud. Sorry, but it’s really bothering me. Second of all, your answer! We do see two separate pictures in our mind, but our brain just combines them so that everything isn’t as confusing. There’s a much more detailed answer that my science teacher could give you, but, honestly, I’m too lazy to explain the whole thing to you right now.
